levels

Class Level

  • java.lang.Object
    • levels.Level
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Level1, Level2, Level3

    public class Level
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to create the level that will be displayed in the background of the game. Features of Version 2.0:
    This class was created, but it is only set up to be coded, it does not do anything yet. Time spent on this class: 10 min.
    Features of Version 3.0:
    This class was completely changed (all the methods are new), now the cells that are spawned are stored in a list, and they fall down. Time spent on this class: 1 hour (additive to previous versions).
    Features of Version 4.0:
    This class was modified a lot to include more processing that was originally in Game. It will not add cells, update positioning, and add a boss when necessary. Time spent on this class (additive to previous versions): 2 hours, 30 minutes.
    Version:
    5.0, June 12, 2014
    Author:
    Salar Hosseini & Sophia Weng

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) Boss boss
      This object reference variable is used to store the boss that the user is to face.
      private boolean bossHasAnimated
      This boolean is used to determine whether the boss has entered the screen or not yet.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Entity> cells
      This object reference variable to ArrayList (Generic type Cell) is used to store all the cells that appear in the game besides the pathogen.
      private int counter
      This integer is used to store a number that increments by 1 every time cells fall down, to determine when the next antibody should spawn.
      int hasWon
      This integer is used to determine whether or not the game is in progress (hasWon = 0), the game has been won (1) or if it has been lost (hasWon = 2).
      (package private) GameInfo info
      This object reference variable to GameInfo is used to access data needed across multiple classes.
      private boolean isTargettingCell
      This boolean is used to store whether the user has started to try to infect the targetted cell or not.
      (package private) java.lang.String name
      This object reference variable to String is used to store a name for the level.
      private Pathogen pathogen
      This object reference variable is used to store the pathogen that the user will control in the game.
      private boolean shouldAdd
      This boolean variable is used to store true if antibodies should be spawning, and false if they should not.
      private int tracker
      This integer is used to store the position of the progress bar in the game.

     Pathogen pathogen,
     GameInfo info)

        pathogen - This object reference variable to Pathogen is used to store the pathogen that the user will control.

      • filterCells

        public void filterCells()
        This method is used to get rid of any cells in the arraylist of cells that have moved past the visible screen. The for loop is used to move through the list of cells and find any that need to be removed. The for loop variable starts at 0, increments by 1 until it is no longer less than the total number of cells in the list. The if statement (nested within the for loop) is used to check if the cell should still be on the list (if it is still on the screen). If not, that cell is removed from the list.
        Parameters:
        x - This integer is a for loop variable that stores the position of the iterations in the for loop. It starts at 0, and increments by 1 until it is no longer less than the total number of cells.

      • update

        public void update()
        This method is used to lower the user's health when they have hit an antibody, as well as update locations of entities. It will also call methods to add more cells when necessary, as well as remove cells that are no longer needed. The main if else is to determine whether or not the user is able to (try to) infect the targetted cell. If they are unable, that means that they are still in game, which means that more white blood cells may be added/filtered. Otherwise, it will update the boss antibody to follow the user around. The nested if within the biggest if statement is used to check if the target should be drawn yet (if enough antibodies have spawned). If so, the target is drawn. The for each loop is used to go through all the antibodies. The if inside is to see if the user has collided with any of them. If they have, their health is lowered, and the antibody is pushed a little distance away. The if statement within the else of the largest if stucture (let this be called if statment 5) is used to check if the boss has animated yet (if it has come down into the screen). If so, then the boss can follow the pathogen. The first if statement within if statement 5 is used to check if the boss and the pathogen have collided. If so, the pathogen takes damage and the two entities move away from each other. The second if statement within if statement 5 is used to check if the target and the pathogen have collided. If so, the target takes damage.
        Parameters:
        directions - This integer array is used to store the direction the antibody should be moved.
        directions - This integer array is used to store the direction the boss should be moved.
        c - This object reference variable to Cell is a for each loop variable that is used to store the Cells stored in the ArrayList of Cells and check for collisions.

      • damageTarget

        public void damageTarget()
        This method is used to complete a portion of code that is repeated more than once. It will lower the health of the target and check if the user has one. The if statement is used to check if the health of the target is less than or equal to 0 which would signify that the user has won (the health can be less than because of the damage it takes, but on the screen it will never show a negative health).

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(int[] directions,
               int type,
               Entity e)
        This method is used to set the new position of an entity, based on the directions provided. The if structure is used to determine how the new position should be set depending on a integer type passed in. The nested if statement is used to determine whether or not the boss should be pushed towards the pathogen or away from it depending on the situation (given by type variable).
        Parameters:
        directions - This integer array is used to store the directions the entity will move in.
        type - This integer will determine how the new position should be obtained.
        e - This object reference to Entity is used to store the entity to be moved.
        moveX2 - This integer is used to store the x amount that the entity is to be moved.
        moveY2 - This integer is used to store the y amount that the entity is to be moved.

      • getBoss

        public Boss getBoss()
        This return method is used to return the boss antibody.
        Returns:
        Boss This will return the boss that the user is to face.

      • setTracker

        public void setTracker(int increment)
        This mutator method is used to alter the tracker of the progress bar by incrementing it by a certain value.
        Parameters:
        increment - This integer is used to store the incrementation of the position of the tracker.

      • shouldDrawTarget

        private boolean shouldDrawTarget()
        This return method is used to check if the target should be drawn. It should be drawn when the progress bar of the level reaches the top. The if statement is used to check if the position of the progress bar has reached the top of the entire bar yet. It so, true is returned.
        Returns:
        boolean True or false is returned depending on if the target should be drawn yet (true if should be).

      • moveCells

        public void moveCells()
        This method is used to move all of the cells besides the pathogen down. The for each loop is used to move through every Object in the List and move its position down by 1. The if statement is used to check if the counter of cells moving down reaches a certain value. When it reaches that value, then another antibody is added.
        Parameters:
        c - This for loop variable is an object reference to Cell which stores the Cell that is in the current iteration of the for each loop.

      • addAntibody

        public void addAntibody()
        This method is used to add antibodies to the list of cells.

      • canInfectTarget

        public boolean canInfectTarget()
        This return method is used to get whether or not the user is at the final stage of a level.
        Returns:
        boolean It returns whether the user is on the final stage of level or not.

      • addTarget

        private void addTarget()
        This method is used to add the targetted cell, as well as the boss.
